meanings.definition: A building joined to or associated with a main building.
meanings.sent1: The small annexe housed the library next to the school.
meanings.sent2: The hotel's annexe provided additional rooms for guests.
meanings.sent3: The annexe was so tiny, it looked like a dollhouse!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an annexe to her intelligence, expanding her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The cozy annexe nestled beside the mansion like a loyal companion.

meanings.definition: To attach or add as an extra or subordinate part.
meanings.sent1: She decided to annexe a new section to her essay for more details.
meanings.sent2: The company plans to annexe a new feature to the existing software.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to annexe his friend to his project team.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature style seemed to annexe itself to every painting.
meanings.sent5: The vines seemed to annexe the fence, intertwining with it like old friends.
